intro: Katapsuxis, commonly known as the wild fig, is a flowering plant belonging to the Moraceae family. It is native to regions of the Mediterranean and parts of southern Europe. The plant produces small, green figs that mature into a purple or black color, containing a sweet, edible pulp. Katapsuxis thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
